GSSM Accelerate Govie, Jack Hyatt, explains the research he conducted during the Accelerate virtual summer camp this year.

"My name is Jack Hyatt and I studied biosystems, specifically the solar side of it. I studied solar stills by trying to create working ones myself. Solar stills are devices that purify water by evaporating water to separate it from the impurities and condensing the water vapor somewhere else so there is a batch of only water. It took me 3 different designs, with each design needing rework, for 6 total attempts to get a working model. My learning experience was great in that I obtained hands-on experience of designs failing, to then needing to look back and rework on those designs. The information I got from the camp overall served as a good introduction to biosystems as something I could be more interested in when I go to college."

Hartsville is today a center of industry, education, and reinvention ‚Äì the South Carolina Governor‚Äôs School for Science and Mathematics, for example, has been built on the site of the Hartsville Cotton Mill. This week has been a week of transition and change for our GSSM Residential community. In light of this pandemic, we thought it would be interesting to see how our community is adjusting to this change of learning and teaching virtually.

Some have set up their office on their beds. Others have migrated to kitchen tables or their couches. Many are trying to figure out how to maintain some normalcy while sharing small spaces with family members.

A few Govies have been meeting virtually every day for lunch. While others have created a couple of QUEST groups. Govies are also creating social Zooms for people to talk about video games and even watch movies together every Wednesday and Saturday. It is safe to say that creativity is not lacking!

This is just a check in to let you know all of us at GSSM are all doing well and cannot wait to be together again! In the meantime, we will be over here sending virtual hugs and high fives. #socialdistancing

We asked one of our Govies to list 5 fun facts about GSSM that you may or may not already know! Check them out below üòÄ

1. During Thanksgiving dinner, Christmas dinner, and Breakfast of Champions, expect there to be a "Govie camp out" before lines open up. The competition is fierce to be the first in line for food and a table.

2. According to some, Breakfast of Champions is the best meal of the school year.

3. During Christmas time, there is an annual contest for the best-decorated dorm room, and the competition is close!

4. There are a lot of sentimental pass downs that Juniors receive from Seniors. These pass downs are a secret. The only way to find out what they are is if you become a Govie.

5. The residential living program is based in a House System, where each floor represents a House. There is a year-long competition each year that each house participates in. Many events are held throughout the year for houses to earn points. The house with the most points at the end of the year receives the legendary House Cup!

#Funfactwednesday

Interim classes are an excellent way for students to ease into the new year, and the wide variety of course offerings allows students to tap into undiscovered talents and explore new hobbies. Several courses include travel, nationally or internationally, and field experiences. In years past, groups have visited places like Silicon Valley and the Galapagos Islands.

Follow us along in January to see all that our Govies are up to during Interim!

Eagles Cross Country had a great day at the State Championship meet this past Tuesday. Our ladies had an incredible season. They were region champs and placed 10th at Upper State. They were able to run hard at State and placed 10th overall. Liza Malcolm was our first finisher, followed by Kaitlin Rodman, Caroline Strinskey, Minnie Liu, Lili Fonteneau, and Maggie Wensink.

Our Boys team had to put in some arduous work. The beginning of the race was neck and neck with Dixie. They fought hard, and 6 of our top 7 placed in the top 15, making them All-State athletes. Karthik Beeraka placed 5th, Garret Youngblood placed 7th, Carter Janse placed 8th, Elic Weeks placed 9th, Palin Kayser placed 10th, and Robert Reeder placed 15th. John Turner also contributed to the team‚Äôs success. The combined efforts from each athlete landed us 2nd place and the title of State Runners Up. It was a great day for the Eagles and a great way to end the season.
